intro: Aspalathus racemosa, commonly known as the Cape tea or African red bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, pink or red flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, and it is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Aspalathus racemosa is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of herbal tea.
